metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage page thumbnails in different sizes

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Content > Pages and select a page (Home)
steps.expected: Page details panel displays with a medium-size thumbnail preview
steps.actual: Page details panel displayed with a thumbnail image (approximately 120x105 pixels) showing a preview of the Home page content

steps.action: Click on the medium thumbnail image in the page details panel
steps.expected: A large thumbnail overlay/lightbox opens showing the full page preview
steps.actual: Clicking the thumbnail opened a large overlay (640x480 size) showing the complete page content preview including header, navigation, and page body

steps.action: Select a URL Type page (URL Type Test Page) in the Pages panel
steps.expected: A default fallback thumbnail is displayed since URL type pages redirect to external URLs and have no actual page content to capture
steps.actual: The URL Type Test Page displayed a default placeholder icon (link/chain icon) instead of a page content preview, confirming the fallback thumbnail mechanism works correctly

steps.action: Navigate to the page details panel and locate Small Icon and Large Icon upload sections
steps.expected: Upload controls for Small Icon and Large Icon are visible with drag-and-drop areas and file selection buttons
steps.actual: Small Icon and Large Icon upload sections are present with 'Drag and Drop a File' areas and 'File' buttons for selecting images

steps.action: Click on the Small Icon upload button
steps.expected: File chooser dialog opens to allow image selection
steps.actual: File chooser dialog opened successfully, accepting image formats (png, jpg, jpeg, bmp, gif, svg+xml)

steps.action: Review code and verify thumbnail generation mechanism
steps.expected: Thumbnails are generated in multiple sizes (XSmall: 48x42, Small: 60x53, Medium: 120x105, Large: 640x480)
steps.actual: Code review confirmed ThumbnailsManagementController generates thumbnails in 4 sizes using the CreateThumbnails method. UI testing showed Medium and Large thumbnails displaying correctly

steps.action: Review code for thumbnail caching mechanism
steps.expected: Thumbnails are cached and include cache-busting timestamps
steps.actual: Code review confirmed thumbnails are stored in the Thumbnails folder and URLs include timestamp parameters (DateTime.Now.Ticks) for cache busting. GetPageThumbnail method returns cached thumbnails with timestamp IDs

observations: The Page Thumbnail feature in Evoq.PersonaBar.Pages provides automatic thumbnail generation for standard pages
Thumbnails are generated in 4 sizes: XSmall (48x42), Small (60x53), Medium (120x105), and Large (640x480)
URL type pages and other non-standard pages show a default fallback icon instead of a page preview
The Small Icon and Large Icon fields in the page details are separate from the page thumbnails - they are custom icons that can be uploaded by users
Thumbnail URLs include timestamp parameters for cache-busting purposes
